Sentencas: The paper presents the results of an investigation into thin single- and triple-layer ZrO2-Sc2O3-based electrolytes prepared using the tape-casting technique in combination with promising electrodes based on La2NiO4+delta and Ni-Ce0.8Sm0.2O2-delta materials.
Titulo: Application of Promising Electrode Materials in Contact with a Thin-Layer ZrO2-Based Supporting Electrolyte for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: It is shown that pressing and joint sintering of single electrolyte layers allows multilayer structures to be obtained that are free of defects at the layer interface.
Titulo: Application of Promising Electrode Materials in Contact with a Thin-Layer ZrO2-Based Supporting Electrolyte for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Electrical conductivity measurements of a triple-layer electrolyte carried out in longitudinal and transverse directions with both direct and alternating current showed resistance of the interface between the layers on the total resistance of the electrolyte to be minimal.
Titulo: Application of Promising Electrode Materials in Contact with a Thin-Layer ZrO2-Based Supporting Electrolyte for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Long-term tests have shown that the greatest degradation in resistance over time occurs in the case of an electrolyte with a tetragonal structure.
Titulo: Application of Promising Electrode Materials in Contact with a Thin-Layer ZrO2-Based Supporting Electrolyte for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Symmetrical electrochemical cells with electrodes fabricated using a screen-printing method were examined by means of electrochemical impedance spectroscopy.
Titulo: Application of Promising Electrode Materials in Contact with a Thin-Layer ZrO2-Based Supporting Electrolyte for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The polarization resistance of the electrodes was 0.45 and 0.16 Ohm.cm(2) at 800 degrees C for the fuel and oxygen electrodes, respectively.
Titulo: Application of Promising Electrode Materials in Contact with a Thin-Layer ZrO2-Based Supporting Electrolyte for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The distribution of relaxation times method was applied for impedance data analysis.
Titulo: Application of Promising Electrode Materials in Contact with a Thin-Layer ZrO2-Based Supporting Electrolyte for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: During tests of a single solid oxide fuel cell comprising a supporting triple-layer electrolyte having a thickness of 300 microns, a power density of about 160 mW/cm(2) at 850 degrees C was obtained using wet hydrogen as fuel and air as an oxidizing gas.
Titulo: Application of Promising Electrode Materials in Contact with a Thin-Layer ZrO2-Based Supporting Electrolyte for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells
